result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Engel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 02-10-2017:  Defendant eligible for SAP.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any addictive substances of any kind, even with a prescription.  Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.

Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Upon completion of the Behavioral Health Services program, balance is stayed.

Plea hearing on December 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ryan M Engel in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matter was set for PLEAH.  State req adj to review negotiations.
  Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges:  Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(d)1-PCS/intent-Heroin; Ct 2: 961.41(3g)(b)-PCS/Controlled substance; Ct 3: 961.573(1)-PDP; Ct 4: 946.41(1)-Obstructing. No driving at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant is to continue in Agape Program.  Defendant is to attend 3 self-help meetings per week and turn in stigned proof of attendance to Agape.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing on December 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.
